summary: This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July 7 to August 10, 2019, while he was held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM). It includes detailed medical encounter notes, vital signs, medication orders, health problem lists, and a transfer summary prepared for his move on August 10, 2019. The records show routine medical management of chronic conditions and note a history of constipation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of all medical records, identified by BOP registration number 76318-054. The documents detail his health status, examinations, and treatments while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM).

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: A medical provider (Mid-Level Provider, e.g., Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant) who conducted Epstein's physical examination on July 9, 2019, and entered several medication orders and vital sign readings.

persons.name: PA-C
persons.context: A physician assistant who administered a PPD (tuberculosis) test to Epstein on July 6, 2019, and noted 'No Known Allergies' in the record.

connections.description: MLP performed a comprehensive physical examination on Epstein on July 9, 2019, and prescribed medication for his constipation.
The MD cosigned the MLP's clinical encounter and is listed as the prescribing provider for several of Epstein's medications and diagnoses.
The MD cosigned the clinical documentation completed by the MLP, indicating a supervisory or collaborative professional relationship.

events.title: Medical Encounter and Examination
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein underwent a comprehensive physical examination by a Mid-Level Provider (MLP) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. He was noted to have a history of constipation and was prescribed Bisacodyl.

events.title: Medical Note Cosign
events.description: A physician (MD) cosigned the medical encounter documentation from the July 9, 2019, examination performed by the MLP.

events.title: Medical Transfer Preparation
events.description: A registered nurse (RN) generated a comprehensive health services transfer summary for Jeffrey Epstein, listing all his health problems, medications, and pending appointments in preparation for a transfer.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM), NEW YORK, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's Bureau of Prisons medical records from July-August 2019 detail the management of multiple chronic health conditions, including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, hypertension, constipation, low back pain, neuralgia, prediabetes, and an elevated BMI.
A transfer summary dated August 10, 2019, was prepared for Epstein, listing his medications, allergies (fish), and cell restrictions (lower bunk).
The records show Epstein was prescribed regular insulin via sliding scale and had a CPAP machine for sleep apnea issued on July 30, 2019.
Epstein refused portions of his physical exam on July 9, 2019, specifically the rectal and male genitalia examinations.
The document notes a history of 'constipation, unspecified' and an 'injury, unspecified' with a comment to 'R/O self inflicted injuries' from July 23, 2019.
